alert.note: Alert for McDowell; Raleigh; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 01 at 9:34AM EST until January 01 at 12:30PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Charleston has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Raleigh County in southeastern West Virginia... Northeastern McDowell County in southern West Virginia... Central Wyoming County in southern West Virginia... * Until 1230 PM EST. * At 934 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Welch, Pineville, Mullens, Sophia, Northfork, Twin Falls State Park, Coal City, Crab Orchard, Beaver, Daniels, Shady Spring, Davy, Lester, Iaeger, Kimball, Rhodell, Maben, Herndon, Josephine and Wolf Pen. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. You may also report severe weather by posting your report to the Charleston West Virginia National Weather Service Facebook Page, or by using the Twitter Hashtag, NWSRLX.
